content: The "Classroom Safety Act of 2000" may be cited as such. Amendments to the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act are included in the Act. The Individuals with Disabilities Education Act is amended to allow school personnel to discipline a child with a disability for carrying weapons or using illegal drugs on school premises. The Individuals with Disabilities Education Act allows school personnel to discipline a child with a disability for possessing illegal drugs at school, with the ability to modify the disciplinary action on a case-by-case basis. The Individuals with Disabilities Education Act allows school personnel to discipline a child with a disability for unintentional possession of weapons or illegal drugs, with the ability to modify the disciplinary action on a case-by-case basis. Children expelled or suspended under this act are not entitled to educational services during the term of their expulsion or suspension. The Individuals with Disabilities Education Act allows school personnel to discipline a child with a disability for possession of weapons or drugs, with the option to provide educational services during expulsion or suspension. The Individuals with Disabilities Education Act allows school personnel to discipline a child with a disability for possession of weapons or drugs, with the option to provide educational services during expulsion or suspension. Local educational agencies are required to provide a free appropriate public education to such children, with the location of services left to their discretion. No agency will be considered in violation of the Act for providing discipline, services, or assistance in accordance with the requirements. In accordance with the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act, actions taken under this paragraph are exempt from certain provisions. Amendments are made to sections regarding disciplinary procedures for children with disabilities.
